alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 8:29PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Aroostook County through 915 PM EDT... At 828 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fort Fairfield, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Presque Isle, Caribou, Fort Fairfield, Limestone, Mars Hill, Easton, Blaine and Westfield. This includes US Highway 1 between Blaine and Mars Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
